item.content:encoded:
Tom Wright dives into heaven, the rapture, and the nature of hell through the lens of Christian eschatology in this thought-provoking episode. They address the dangers of sensationalism in interpreting scripture and emphasize the importance of viewing these topics within the broader narrative of God’s new creation.


💡 Does God send sinners to eternal torment? Where is heaven exactly? Can baptized Christians who fall away from faith still face hell? How can we be certain of our salvation? These crucial questions are explored, alongside key insights into dispensationalism, misunderstandings about the rapture, and the relational reality of heaven.


✨ The conversation also unpacks:

  • The restrained New Testament view of hell as tragic loss, not eternal torment.
  • Comfort from biblical texts like Romans and Isaiah for those struggling with faith or anxiety.
  • The enduring connection between heaven and earth in biblical theology


👉 Whether you’re wrestling with questions about salvation, curious about the nature of hell, or seeking a deeper understanding of Christian eschatology, this episode offers clarity, hope, and encouragement.


Got Questions for Tom? Go to: askntwright.com

item.content:encoded:
Dr. Mike Bird and Tom NT Wright take us on a deeply personal journey through their denominational experiences in today's episode of the podcast. From Anglican roots to Catholic insights, they explore the rich tapestry of Christian traditions and reflect on how faith evolves across life’s seasons.


💡 Together, they tackle a listener's heartfelt dilemma: navigating faith within a family where religious backgrounds differ. Should you join the Catholic Church or embrace a Reformed tradition? Tom and Mike unpack this complex decision, emphasizing the role of conscience, community, and theological understanding in shaping one’s spiritual path.

The discussion also dives into the transformative doctrine of justification, examining the interplay of faith, works, and the Holy Spirit in the believer's life. Unity among Christians and the ongoing sanctification process are central themes, offering fresh perspectives for anyone wrestling with denominational differences or seeking deeper theological insight.


✨ Highlights include:

  • Tom Wright's reflections on growing up Anglican and its profound impact on his theology.
  • Mike Bird’s vibrant denominational journey, from Baptist beginnings to his embrace of Anglicanism.
  • A breakdown of Catholic and Protestant views on justification, faith, and works.
  • The unifying power of the Holy Spirit in the global Church.


👉 Whether you’re exploring your own denominational identity, facing family faith tensions, or yearning for a better understanding of Christian unity, this episode is packed with wisdom to inspire and challenge you.


🎧 Tune in now, share with someone navigating their faith journey, and join the conversation!


#AskNTWrightAnything #FaithAndFamily #DenominationalJourneys #HolySpirit #ChristianUnity #Justification #FaithAndWorks

In the highly anticipated Season 2 premiere of the Ask NT Wright Anything podcast, Dr. Michael Bird joins legendary theologian Tom Wright for an inspiring deep dive into the historical foundations of Christianity.


Together, they explore, why historical accuracy matters in understanding the Bible, unpack the literary tools used in scripture and reflect on the resurrection’s profound impact on time and identity .


💡 The episode also tackles tough questions about skepticism surrounding the resurrection, exploring common theories and the historical expectations of a Messiah. Whether you’re grappling with doubts or seeking to deepen your faith, this is a conversation you don’t want to miss!


👉 Have a burning question for Tom? Submit it now at askntwright.com and it could be featured in an upcoming episode!


🎧 Tune in, share with a friend, and join the conversation!

item.content:encoded:
A bit of a twist today as we answer listener's questions that have come in asking: are we meant to take Satan literally? Join Tom Wright as he unravels some of the intricate threads of the New and Old Testaments to uncover the biblical portrayal of the devil. We're looking at some of the questions and looking at biblical passages where Jesus confronts and challenges the forces of darkness, asking what role does the Devil play in affecting ministry and what power does Satan really have? Do we over-think the devil and the supernatural when we avoid heavy metal music, particular pop stars or ban Harry Potter books - where is the line between genuine caution and a kind of 'satanic panic'? What practices should we avoid that should be recognised as 'evil'? And remembering Jesus' ultimate defeat of Satan and death on the cross.

Enjoy this thought-provoking discussion that we hope sheds some light on this complex and often misunderstood (or sometimes avoided) topic of 'evil', 'satan' and 'the devil'.


Originally Aired: 30 December 2019
